user_prompt: How do you play basketball

- Offense
- Defense
- Rebounding
- Stealing

The offense is played on the left side of the court with the ball being passed from player to player. Each player is allowed to shoot the ball once, a defensive player can defend the basket by passing the ball to an open teammate. Once the ball is passed, the offensive player shoots the ball and the defensive player has to quickly pass it to a teammate to make a basket. Once the ball is made, the offensive player is awarded 2 points.

The defense is played on the right side of the court. The offense is passing the ball to the open teammates on the right. Once the ball is passed, the defensive player has to quickly pass it to a teammate who is open, to make a basket. Once the ball is made, the defensive player is awarded 1 point and the offensive player is awarded 2 points.

Rebounding is the ability to get the ball from the offensive player to an open teammate on the court. The offensive player can shoot the ball and the rebounder has to pass the ball to an open teammate on the other side. Once the ball is passed, the offensive player can shoot the ball and the rebounder has to immediately pass it to a teammate to make a basket. Once the ball is made the offensive player will receive 1 point and the rebounder will receive 2 points.

Stealing is the ability to get the ball from the offensive player to an open teammate who is not on the court. When the offensive player shoots the ball, the ball is stolen from the other team.
